thread.title: Schnitzer-owned steel mill fined for skipping required lead tests
thread.title_full: Schnitzer-owned steel mill fined for skipping required lead tests | OregonLive.com

author: The Associated Press
title: Schnitzer-owned steel mill fined for skipping required lead tests
text:
McMINNVILLE â€” A McMinnville steel mill owned by Schnitzer Steel has been fined more than $7,000 for violating its water pollution permit.
The Statesman Journal reports that Cascade Steel Rolling Mills is being fined because it stopped performing required monthly water sampling for lead and zinc.
The state Department of Environmental Quality says the monitoring has been required since 2002 under the facility's National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System permit.
A spokesman for Schnitzer Steel in Portland said the mill is now monitoring as required.
Colin Kelly says Cascade Steel discovering a monitoring oversight as part of its internal review and immediately notified the Department of Environmental Quality and fixed the program.
The company has until Oct. 22 to appeal the penalty.
The McMinnville mill makes rebar , coiled rebar, wire rod and other hot-rolled steel products. All are made from recycled steel.
-- The Associated Press
